text: my name is Mark hatch adorian I'm the
curator of orchids here at the New York
Botanical Garden and welcome to the
orchid show well this year's designed
this conceptual design marriage with
this marriage between broadway and the
orchid shell we've really tried to sort
of capture a lot of the drama the thrill
the color the lights the glitz of
Broadway and kind of translate that
emotional response into the physical
aspect of the orchids by choosing some
of the flashiest blooms stuff that has a
lot of color fragrance pattern and by
arranging the plants in the exhibition
give that same impression that's kind of
wow factor that people have when they
first go to a Broadway theater
experience the Broadway itself in New
York City in our previous exhibitions we
worked with landscape designers to
create much more Geographic themes
conjuring up sort of this travel image
but this year's orchid show we've gone
with a different type of designer a
Broadway set famous Broadway set
designer Scott Pask and then as a result
used his influence and his design ideas
to create a very theatrical element even
though most of our orchid exhibitions
still have that theatrical element we've
now gone that one step further and
brought in the idea of the Broadway
theatre to create that dramatic element
to really surprise the visitor and bring
them to a place and hopefully re conjure
some of that emotion and recapture it
but this time through flowers rather
than the theater itself
